snippet: Voters backed measures to reintroduce restrictions on the number of foreigners allowed to live and work in the country, a move that could have implications for the nation’s ties with the European Union.
abstract: Narrow majority of voters in Switzerland approve proposals to reintroduce restrictions on number of foreigners who are allowed to live and work in the country; move could have far-reaching implications for Switzerland’s relations with European Union.

byline.contributor: Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Madrid.

lead_paragraph: Voters backed measures to reintroduce restrictions on the number of foreigners allowed to live and work in the country, a move that could have implications for the nation’s ties with the European Union.

headline.main: Swiss Voters Narrowly Approve Curbs on Immigration
headline.print_headline: Swiss Voters Narrowly Approve Restrictions on Immigration
